titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid to the Kansas City Womyn's Chorus records SSC.MS.00568
titlestmt.author: Madison White

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-10-15 09:50:57 -0400.

change.item: This record was migrated from InMagic DB Textworks to ArchivesSpace.

did.abstract: The collection contains scrapbooks documenting the the Kansas City Womyn's Chorus' events, gatherings, and performances, and music scores. The Kansas City Womyn's Chorus was founded as a diverse group of women for the purpose of singing non-sexist music and to "share, celebrate, and build women's culture."

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use with following restrictions on access: Donor stipulates on Certificate of Gift: "Please feel free to allow duplication of tapes, CDs, and DVDs by qualified researchers. Keep the music out there."Names of songwriters and arrangers must be provided with duplicates and they must be credited. AV materials may not be used until in-house use copies are made. Collection has not been fully processed and therefore may be somewhat difficult to use. Collection is stored offsite; researchers must give 48 hours advance notice.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The collection was gifted by Linda Ray in 2007.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Kansas City Womyn's Chorus was founded in 1979 by a diverse group of women for the purpose of singing non-sexist music and to "share, celebrate, and build women's culture." The chorus aimed to be open to anyone who wished to participate, and many members had no muscial training, some didn't read music. For every concert, those with real musical skill took on mentoring those who had trouble staying on pitch so that they could be a part of the chorus; many women laboriously made practice tapes of all the parts to help members with less skill learn their parts. The group performed primarily in local event. After participating in a regional festival in DeKalb, Illinois in 1995, with barely enough members attending to perform, the chorus disbanded.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: The collection has a container list that is available upon request by contacting specialcollections@smith.edu

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Kansas City Womyn's Chorus records, Sophia Smith Collection, SSC-MS-00568, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Mass.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scrapbooks documenting the group's events, gatherings, and performances, and music scores.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: To the extent that she owns copyright, Linda Ray has assigned the copyright of Kansas City Womyn's Chorus' works to Smith College; however, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by Kansas City Womyn's Chorus, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.
